summary.para: The CERT_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS_INFO structure contains information that indicates whether the certified subject can act as a certification authority (CA), an end entity, or both. If the subject can act as a CA, a certification path-length constraint can also be specified, as can a set of subtrees that must contain all subject names of subsequent certificates in a certification chain. This extension is used in validating certificates used to sign other certificates.
The function creates an instance of this structure when performed on a structure's Value member with its structure's pszObjId member set to szOID_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS.
A value can contain one of the following:

item.description: A CERT_CA_SUBJECT_FLAG that, when set, indicates that the certificate's subject can act as a CA.
A CERT_END_ENTITY_SUBJECT_FLAG that, when set, indicates that the certificate's subject can act as an end entity.
Both of the above, combined using a bitwise-OR operation.

member.name: CERT_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS_INFO.fPathLenConstraint
member.summary: A Boolean value that indicates whether the dwPathLenConstraint field sets the maximum length of the certification path.

member.name: CERT_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS_INFO.dwPathLenConstraint
member.summary: The maximum number of CA certificates that can follow this certificate in a certification validation path. A value of zero indicates that the subject of this certificate can issue certificates only to end entities and not to CAs.

member.name: CERT_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS_INFO.cSubtreesConstraint
member.summary: The number of elements in the rgSubtreesConstraint array.

member.name: CERT_BASIC_CONSTRAINTS_INFO.rgSubtreesConstraint
member.summary: An array ofCERT_NAME_BLOB structures that establish subtree constraints.
